ygData.subject: Re: Levels after hell levels
ygData.msgSnippet: you give them to much credit, Its what is called a bug it just so happens this bug helps keep the coin rolling in so now its a feature. Programmer probably got
ygData.messageBody:
you give them to much credit, Its what is called a bug it just so happens
this bug helps keep the coin rolling in so now its a feature. Programmer
probably got a nice bonus for doing shoddy work

James French
----- Original Message -----
From: <kim@...>
To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
Sent: Monday, February 21, 2000 2:25 PM
Subject: [eqbards] Levels after hell levels


> From: <kim@...>
>
> It happened again, but slightly differently this time.
>
> When I was level 30, I lost about a quarter bubble per death.
> I reached 31, then died without having gained any experience.
> I lost a bit more than a half bubble into 30.
>
> I hit 47 last night, then died without having gained any
> experience in it. I lost "only" a bit more than a half bubble
> into 46. My friends who've died at 46 all said they lost
> about 1-1/4 to 1-1/2 bubble per death in it.
>
> So it really looks like you lose a lot more experience in the
> levels after hell levels. I'd love to flame the genius at
> Verant who thought that one up.
>
> --
> John H. Kim
> kim@...
>
